intro: Cissampelos fruticosa, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange to red berries that contain seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
